statement.p: What is the area of this floor in square feet?

solution.p: This floor area consists of a rectangular area (on the left) and a triangular area (on the right). First measurements should all be converted to the same unit.
Top edge: \displaystyle{11}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{2}\ \text{ in}={134}\ \text{ in}
Left edge: \displaystyle{5}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{8}\ \text{ in}={68}\ \text{ in}
Bottom edge: \displaystyle{5}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{7}\ \text{ in}={67}\ \text{ in}
We do not need the length of the right edge (angled).
The area of the rectangle is \displaystyle{\left({68}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({67}\ \text{ in}\right)}={4556}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

The triangles top edge has length \displaystyle{\left({134}\ \text{ in}\right)}-{\left({67}\ \text{ in}\right)}={67}\ \text{ in}. The left edge is 68 in. Thus the area of the triangle is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left({68}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({67}\ \text{ in}\right)}={2278}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

Thus the total area is \displaystyle{4556}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}+{2278}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}={6834}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}. Converting this to square feet it becomes \displaystyle{6834}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}\right)}^{{2}}=\frac{{6834}}{{144}}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}={47.458333333333}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}\approx{47}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}.
